pr_title: Google Code Style plugin and conformance OKAPI-809

timeline.message:
Google Java style OKAPI-809

There are two classes where things are suppressed a bit.

LaunchDescriptor.java does not follow naming conventions, but since
it's encoded to JSON we can not change those names now without
breaking compatibility.

ProcessModuleHandle.java where checkstyle insists on 8 blanks
for 2nd lamba and Idea editor formats to 6 blanks (I believe Idea
editor is right, so leaving those at 6)

Rename dockerCMD to dockerCmd internally

No need to suppress checks for LaunchDescriptor anymore.

timeline.body: This circumvents the intention of the rule to avoid the single letter abbreviation `m` in the first chunk of the two chunk name `mSet` or `mset`. It violates the rule that each word within the variable is camel cased. `mset` is not a word. Either rename to `set` or `modifierSet` or `m` or `s` or use `mods.forEach(sn::addSortIndex)`.
timeline.bodyText: This circumvents the intention of the rule to avoid the single letter abbreviation m in the first chunk of the two chunk name mSet or mset. It violates the rule that each word within the variable is camel cased. mset is not a word. Either rename to set or modifierSet or m or s or use mods.forEach(sn::addSortIndex).
timeline.bodyHTML: This circumvents the intention of the rule to avoid the single letter abbreviation m in the first chunk of the two chunk name mSet or mset. It violates the rule that each word within the variable is camel cased. mset is not a word. Either rename to set or modifierSet or m or s or use mods.forEach(sn::addSortIndex).
timeline.author: julianladisch

timeline.body:
This unnecessary default clause prevents detection of missing enum values if we add more in future.
https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s4.8.4.3-switch-default
Sonar checks for enum completeness: https://sonarcloud.io/organizations/folio-org/rules?open=java%3AS131&rule_key=java%3AS131
timeline.bodyText:

timeline.body:
"static" is in the method signature and should not been repeated in the javadoc summary fragment.
It does not compare modules, it compares modul ids.
Can you rename the parameters from i1 to moduleId1 and i2 to moduleId2?
```suggestion
   * Module id comparison.
```
timeline.bodyText:
"static" is in the method signature and should not been repeated in the javadoc summary fragment.
It does not compare modules, it compares modul ids.
Can you rename the parameters from i1 to moduleId1 and i2 to moduleId2?
  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
               * Static module comparison.
          
          
            
               * Module id comparison.
timeline.bodyHTML:
"static" is in the method signature and should not been repeated in the javadoc summary fragment.
It does not compare modules, it compares modul ids.
Can you rename the parameters from i1 to moduleId1 and i2 to moduleId2?

Suggested change
* Static module comparison.
* Module id comparison.

timeline.message:
Closer to Google code style

Keep the original and our modified "FOLIO" version in checkstyle
directory. Changes from Google style: line wrap indentation of 2
rather than 4 and enable suppress warnings filter.

timeline.author: julianladisch

timeline.body: In addition `id` should be renamed to `tenantId` to also have this information in the method signature. Some IDEs like Eclipse insert the method signature when doing auto-complete.

+  /**

+   * @param ports ports to be available
+   * @param moduleHost module host override (for Docker)

+   * @param config configuration
+   * @return module handle
+   */

replies.bodyText: Since the id is a module-Id using tenantId here would be very misleading. Did you mean moduleId? I agree that since id is used in many classes to mean either tenant-Id or module-Id or even interface-Id it would be good to rename. But let's leave that to another PR, shall we?
replies.author: adamdickmeiss

timeline.message:
Many minor javadoc fixes, typos

Some spotted by Julian and some reported by IJ IDEA.
lineWrappingIndentation=4 and sh*load of formatting changes
